meanings.definition: A flexible, curved weapon for shooting arrows.
meanings.sent1: He aimed the bowr carefully before releasing the arrow.
meanings.sent2: The archer practiced with his bowr every day to improve his aim.
meanings.sent3: The bowr looked like a magical tool in the hands of the skilled archer.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as a drawn bowr, ready to hit the target.
meanings.sent5: The bowr's string hummed with tension, waiting to be released.

meanings.definition: To bend the upper part of the body forward as a sign of respect or greeting.
meanings.sent1: He would bowr politely whenever he met someone new.
meanings.sent2: The children would bowr to their teacher at the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to bowr but ended up falling on its face comically.
meanings.sent4: The trees seemed to bowr in the wind's strong embrace.
meanings.sent5: She would bowr gracefully, showing her respect to the elders.

meanings.definition: A knot tied with two loops and two loose ends.
meanings.sent1: She secured the package with a tight bowr.
meanings.sent2: The bowr on the gift added a touch of elegance to it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the bowr on the present, unraveling it.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was like a securely tied bowr, never coming undone.
meanings.sent5: The bowr on her shoelaces always seemed to come undone at the worst times.
